div.head: Red gum
div.ab: Take red wax of vermillion and a little resin pitch, and make as described above.

div.head: Bronze of copper
div.ab: Take some verdigris and clear glue and grind them together. Then apply a layer over your wood, and take some pin filings and grind it on a marble with water, then apply it over the wood and polish it with copper.

div.head: Bronze like tin
div.ab: Take some bismuth and two ounces of quicksilver. Melt the bismuth into a new pot, as soon as it becomes completely melted add the quicksilver and then remove it from the fire. Leave the aforementioned glue to dry, then take a piece of tin, and burnish it on a marble slab with clear water, then coat it over the wood and polish it with a piece of tin.

div.head: Making aqua fortis
div.ab: Take a demi-sestier of vinegar with one ounce of verdigris, one ounce of copperas and one ounce of solle, then pour all the ingredients into a glass vial.

div.head: Ground gold
div.ab: Take some fine gold and put it on a very clean marble slab. Add aqua fortis and start grinding. Then take some saltpetre and ammonia salt, pour it into a large, clean shell.
